entries.title: McConnell: Biden's hardline debt ceiling stance clashes with past willingness of negotiate
entries.description: Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell, a Kentucky Republican, joined 'The Story' to sound off ahead of President Biden's State of the Union address.

entries.title: Pennsylvania Walmart customer upset over long lines, customer service pours bleach, oil, syrup onto floors
entries.description: A man in Pennsylvania had a fit of rage and threw jelly, motor oil, and a slew of other slippery items onto the floors of Walmart after having a bad customer service experience and waiting in line too long.

entries.title: Viral gender reveal fireworks video sets social media ablaze: 'Baby announcement or forest fire?'
entries.description: A couple is taking heat online after a video went viral of them setting off explosive fireworks during a gender reveal party in a yard surrounded by trees.

entries.title: South Carolina governor nominates new Veterans' Affairs director
entries.description: The South Carolina governor nominated retired Maj. Gen. Todd McCaffrey to be the new Veterans Affairs director. He is expected to replace outgoing Secretary William Grimsley.

entries.title: Fall trial planned for man charged with killing mom at sea
entries.description: A fall trial has been planned for a man who has been charged with killing his mom at sea. Investigators say the man had a scheme to inherit millions of dollars after killing his mother.

entries.title: Activists hope detention officer's indictment prompts changes in Texas jail
entries.description: A group of activists are hoping a detention officer's indictment will prompt changes in the Texas jail. The officer is facing a charge of manslaughter in the death of an inmate.

entries.title: Vermont Gov. Scott calls for civility following deadly school basketball brawl
entries.description: Republican Vermont Gov. Phil Scott called for civility in the aftermath of a brawl at a middle school basketball game that killed a 60-year-old Alburgh man.

entries.title: Jake Paul will 'need' an ambulance 'on speed dial' against Tommy Fury, opponent says
entries.description: Tommy Fury is predicting an early, gruesome knockout of Jake Paul in their fight later this month in Saudi Arabia. In fact, he thinks Paul will need medical attention.

entries.title: Maine Democrats make push for paid family leave
entries.description: Democrats in the Maine Legislature are spearheading an effort to implement paid family leave proposals into statewide law, citing inaction at the federal level.

entries.title: New Hampshire considering 'mental health' days for K-12 students
entries.description: Advocates for "mental health days" in K-12 schools testified before New Hampshire's House Education Committee as the state weighs implementing them in its public school system.

entries.title: Kyrie Irving explains why apology for posting antisemitic movie link was deleted
entries.description: The Dallas Mavericks' Kyrie Irving met with media today for the first time. During the session, he was asked why his apology for posting an antisemitic movie link was deleted.

entries.title: Houston career criminal sentenced to 50 years in prison for violent fatal crash into Uber car: reports
entries.description: A Houston, Texas man was handed a 50-year prison sentence after being found guilty of murder linked to a crash he caused when he fled police in 2020.

entries.title: Melinda Dillon’s ‘A Christmas Story’ co-star mourns her death, ‘fortunate’ to call her his ‘on-screen mother’
entries.description: "A Christmas Story" star Peter Billingsley shared a sweet message about the passing of his on-screen mom Melinda Dillon. Dillon died last month at the age of 83.

entries.title: State of the Union: Rep. Scott Perry invites pro-life activist Mark Houck as guest to presidential address
entries.description: Rep. Scott Perry is taking pro-life activist Mark Houck to the State of the Union on Tuesday night after he was acquitted in late-January.

entries.title: LeBron James feels he is the ‘best basketball player that ever played the game’
entries.description: Los Angeles Lakers All-Star LeBron James says he feels he is the "best basketball player that ever played the game" as he approaches the NBA's all-time scoring record.

entries.title: Column arguing eggs are 'really cheap' compared to 100 years ago blasted: 'Freaking nuts'
entries.description: Washington Post columnist Megan McArdle wrote a column arguing that the price of eggs is relatively inexpensive compared to prices from over 100 years ago.

entries.title: Kaycee Marchetti, girlfriend of Eagles star Fletcher Cox, says it's 'such an honor' to be named top WAG
entries.description: Kaycee Marchetti, the girlfriend of Philadelphia Eagles star Fletcher Cox, reacted on social media to being named the top WAG on the team.

entries.title: Mick Fleetwood says Fleetwood Mac might be 'done' performing together after Christine McVie's death
entries.description: Fleetwood Mac founding member Mick Fleetwood said he thinks the band is "done" performing after the November death of longtime member Christine McVie.

entries.title: Hawaii firefighter dies after being swept into storm drain
entries.description: A Hawaii firefighter died Saturday after being swept into a storm drain while responding to a storm on Maui. The firefighter was in critical condition at the hospital before he died.

entries.title: Father sues Wisconsin school district for using Floyd-esque knee restraint on daughter
entries.description: An Illinois man is suing a Wisconsin school district over an incident in which an off-duty police officer knelt on his daughter's neck during a fight.

entries.title: New York off-duty cop shot during attempted robbery dies
entries.description: The NYPD officer who was shot in the head while off-duty during an attempted robbery died Tuesday.

entries.title: Nicaragua sentences Catholic priests to 10 years for conspiracy after closed-door trials
entries.description: Four Roman Catholic priests in Nicaragua have been sentenced to 10 years in prison for what human rights groups contend is part of the government's crackdown on protesters.

entries.title: Arizona school photographer arrested for allegedly sexually exploiting minors: reports
entries.description: An Arizona school photographer was arrested last week for allegedly sexually exploiting minors over the internet through a public chat room.

entries.title: Marjorie Taylor Greene trolls Biden's State of the Union with white balloon
entries.description: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene, R-Ga., brought a helium balloon to the U.S. Capitol on Tuesday in an apparent attempt to troll President Biden ahead of his speech later.

entries.title: Lindsay Clancy's husband 'begged kids to breathe' after MA mom allegedly 'heard voices' to kill them
entries.description: Duxbury, Massachusetts mom Lindsay Clancy, 32, was arraigned in a hospital on charges connected to the murders of her three children, whom she allegedly killed before attempting suicide.

entries.title: Biden administration pushes back on GOP effort to end vaccine requirement for international air travelers
entries.description: The Biden administration pushed back on efforts by Rep. Thomas Massie, R-Ky., to end the coronavirus vaccine requirement for international air travelers.

entries.title: Chiefs’ Andy Reid ‘proud’ of Eagles roots but says ‘now we go our separate ways and get ready to play’
entries.description: Kansas City Chiefs head coach Andy Reid spoke fondly of his time in Philadelphia Tuesday but said his ties to the Eagles won’t be a distraction in Super Bowl LVII.

entries.title: Washington elementary excludes White students from ‘safe space’ club, mentor program, email shows
entries.description: Centennial Elementary in Olympia established a 5th-grade "Black, Indigenous, and People of Color (BIPOC) Mentor Group" that the principal says excludes White students.

entries.title: Kansas man responsible for grass fire near governor's mansion jailed
entries.description: A Kansas man has been jailed due to a grass fire that he intentionally started near the governor's mansion. The fire he started burned six acres of land and took two hours to put out.

entries.title: Pakistan bus, car collision kills 22 people, injures 12
entries.description: A Pakistan bus and car collision killed 22 people and injured 12 others on Tuesday. It is the second deadly accident to occur in less than a week in Pakistan.

entries.title: Virginia man killed when train strikes his truck at railroad crossing
entries.description: A Virginia man was killed when a train struck his truck at a railroad crossing on Monday night. The man disregarded a stop sign before he was hit on the tracks.

entries.title: New Mexico bill ordering pretrial detention change could cost state $15.3M a year
entries.description: A pretrial detention change could end up costing New Mexico $15.3 million a year. The state Senate bill calls for those convicted of violent crimes to remain jailed without bond.

entries.title: Wisconsin Supreme Court justices make endorsements in contested race for seat
entries.description: Wisconsin's Supreme Court justices have begun endorsing candidates in a quickly-approaching election to a seat that will determine the balance of power.

entries.title: Former presidential candidate Ralph Nader helps launch new newspaper
entries.description: Ralph Nader, the Green Party's presidential nominee in 2000, has begun mailing out copies of the Winsted Citizen, a print newspaper he bankrolled in his native Connecticut.

entries.title: Jerry Lawler on the mind of pro wrestling world as he reportedly suffered stroke
entries.description: WWE legend Jerry Lawler was reportedly hospitalized in Florida after suffering a stroke. Fans of the pro wrestler sent their prayers and well wishes on social media.

entries.title: Massachusetts woman finds frozen shark washed up on Cape Cod beach
entries.description: A large, partially frozen porbeagle shark was found washed ashore a Cape Cod beach following a record-breaking cold snap that plunged the Northeast to sub-zero temperatures.

entries.title: Minnesota family's giant 30-foot snowman brings community together: 'People love him as much as we do'
entries.description: A family in Buffalo, Minnesota, built a giant 30-foot snowman in their front yard and it has attracted curious visitors from all over the state.

entries.title: Dallas suspect in theft of zoo monkeys planned to keep stealing animals: report
entries.description: The man suspected of stealing monkeys from the Dallas Zoo allegedly said he would steal more animals if released from police custody.

entries.title: Leonardo DiCaprio not dating 19-year-old model despite photo sending Twitter into frenzy
entries.description: Leonardo DiCaprio sparked dating rumors after being photographed with a 19-year-old model, but Fox News Digital has learned that the two are not a couple.

entries.title: Eagles' Nick Sirianni responds to odd question about players dating his 5-year-old daughter
entries.description: Bizarre questions at Super Bowl Media Day are not uncommon, but a question on Monday to Nick Sirianni might take the crown for the oddest ever.

entries.title: California-based Navy officer charged with cyberstalking civilian woman
entries.description: A San Diego U.S. Naval officer was arraigned in federal court Monday to face charges of cyberstalking a civilian woman, including creating social media accounts under her name.

entries.title: Chiefs’ Andy Reid reveals three interesting keys to live by ahead of Super Bowl LVII
entries.description: Kansas City Chiefs head coach Andy Reid got candid about the three keys of life during opening night of Super Bowl LVII on Monday.

entries.title: Nets plan on keeping Kevin Durant despite trading away Kyrie Irving: report
entries.description: With the NBA trade deadline set for 3 p.m. Thursday, the Nets are reportedly informing teams that Kevin Durant is not for sale despite the Kyrie Irving trade.

entries.title: Tom Girardi, ex ‘Housewives’ husband and disbarred lawyer, pleads not guilty to client thefts
entries.description: "Real Housewives of Beverly Hills" star Erika Jayne's ex-husband Tom Girardi pleaded not guilty in court Monday for allegedly embezzling $15 million from clients.

entries.title: Church of England to consider gender-neutral God: reports
entries.description: The Church of England is considering referring to God in “non-gendered” terms during church services in break with centuries of tradition.

entries.title: Ex-wife of man accused of running down, stabbing California doctor feared for her safety before attack: report
entries.description: Vanroy Evan Smith's ex-wife feared for her own safety in the weeks leading up to the murder of California doctor Michael Mammone last Wednesday, her father said.

entries.title: Conservatives preempt Biden’s SOTU speech criticizing his leadership: 'The State of the Union = DETERIORATING’
entries.description: Conservatives preempted President Biden's State of the Union address on Tuesday with their own thoughts on the state of the United States.

entries.title: Chiefs' Patrick Mahomes on Tyreek Hill: 'We lost an all-time great receiver,' but credits coaches for adapting
entries.description: During the Super Bowl's opening night, Chiefs quarterback Patrick Mahomes reflected on the team's key decision to trade star wide receiver Tyreek Hill.

entries.title: Aaron Rodgers' NFL decision will come after 'isolation retreat' where he will be in complete darkness
entries.description: Aaron Rodgers has always been one to step outside of his comfort zone, but how about this: He will go on a retreat in complete darkness to make his decision for next season.

entries.title: Virginia designates Chincoteague Island pony as official state horse
entries.description: Virginia Commonwealth lawmakers approved a bill on Tuesday to designate the Chincoteague Island pony as the official state horse, with 93 yays and seven nays.

entries.title: Tyre Nichols death: Memphis officials say eight additional police officers could face discipline
entries.description: Memphis officials say that eight additional police officers may be suspended in an investigation following the death of Tyre Nichols on Jan. 10.

entries.title: Idaho murders: How does criminology student leave crime scene with blood-dripping knife?
entries.description: The Ka-Bar knife sheath found next to Madison Mogen's remains at the Moscow, Idaho, crime scene could have been left intentionally in a bid to mislead police.

entries.title: Pink Floyd bandmates feud over member’s antisemitic, pro-Putin remarks: ‘Guess the reunion is off'
entries.description: "Pink Floyd" guitarist David Gilmour and his wife put out blunt tweets blasting former bandmate Roger Waters' political views, as well as his personal behavior.

entries.title: Migrants encounters drop to 150,000 in January, lowest since early 2021: sources
entries.description: There were approximately 150,000 migrant encounters at the southern border in January, multiple sources tell Fox News, the lowest number since February 2021.

entries.title: Alec Baldwin files motion to remove special prosecutor in 'Rust' case
entries.description: Alec Baldwin's lawyer filed a motion to have the special prosecutor assigned to the "Rust" case disqualified. Baldwin was charged with involuntary manslaughter on Jan. 31.

entries.title: Bomb in southwest Pakistan kills soldier, injures 11 people
entries.description: A bombing Sunday in southwest Pakistan killed a soldier and wounded 11 people, who were mostly civilians. The Pakistani Taliban took responsibility for the attack.

entries.title: 5 amazing Siri hacks you'll want to use all the time
entries.description: Kurt "CyberGuy" Knutsson outlines his top five Siri hacks to make your day-to-day activities easier, from checking your emails to going to the gas station.

entries.title: Suspect in off-duty NYPD officer shooting arrested at motel
entries.description: The suspect in an off-duty NYPD officer shooting has been arrested at a motel. The officer met the suspect to buy a car for $24,000 then put officer in a headlock demanding money.

entries.title: Islamic extremists in Mozambique kill international aid worker
entries.description: Extremists in Mozambique reportedly killed a Doctors Without Borders worker soon after one of the organization's top officials was asked to report on regional humanitarian conditions.

entries.title: Florida deputies arrest high school employee who allegedly had sex with underage student
entries.description: Florida deputies say that a paraprofessional at Freedom High School allegedly had sex with a 16-year-old student in December 2022 at her residence.

entries.title: Indiana lawmakers advance plan to give illegal immigrants driving cards
entries.description: Indiana lawmakers have advanced a proposal for the first time that, if passed into law, would allow illegal immigrants to obtain state-issued cards allowing them to drive.

entries.title: British headteacher found dead in home along with husband, daughter
entries.description: Emma Pattison, 45, was found dead in her home Sunday, alongside her husband and seven-year-old daughter. Pattison was the headteacher of Epsom College, an elite private school.

entries.title: State of the Union: Biden to lay out ‘starkly different’ plan on taxes, spending compared to House GOP
entries.description: President Biden will use his State of the Union address to lay out a “starkly different” plan for the economy than what House Republicans have proposed.

entries.title: Elon Musk answers Republican's complaint over Sen. Steve Daines' Twitter lock: 'This is being fixed'
entries.description: Elon Musk addressed complaints circulating Twitter over Montana Republican Sen. Steve Daines' account locked down over a profile picture showcasing his wife's latest hunt.

entries.title: Eagles' Darius Slay recalls 'disrespect' from former Lions coach ahead of Super Bowl LVII
entries.description: Philadelphia Eagles star Darius Slay touched on his time with the Detroit Lions and his rift with former coach Matt Patricia. Slay was traded to the Eagles in 2020.

entries.title: Biden judicial nominee under fire for alleged lack of legal knowledge, experience
entries.description: President Biden's nominee for a federal judgeship in Washington state is facing scrutiny for what critics call a lack of legal knowledge and experience.

entries.title: Don't look up: The bigger China threat worrying lawmakers is in the palm of your hand, not the sky
entries.description: Lawmakers are searching for ways to limit the risks from TikTok, owned by a Chinese conglomerate with ties to the CCP, as tensions with China increases.

entries.title: 49ers plan to hire former Panthers interim head coach as next defensive coordinator: report
entries.description: The San Francisco 49ers are planning to hire former Carolina Panthers interim head coach Steve Wilks to be their next defensive coordinator, replacing DeMeco Ryans.

entries.title: Biden's IRS plans to crack down on waiters' tips
entries.description: The Internal Revenue Service is moving ahead with a proposal to crack down on service industry tip reporting in an effort the agency said would provide "certainty to taxpayers."

entries.title: Pollster sounds alarm on Biden's 'most concerning' poll number: 'Underwater on every front'
entries.description: Pollster Lee Carter joined "Faulkner Focus" to discuss Biden's poll numbers ahead of the State of the Union address and what he should communicate to voters in the speech

entries.title: Eagles’ CJ Gardner-Johnson rips Giants player over Nick Sirianni criticism: ‘Ain't no leadership over there'
entries.description: Several Philadelphia Eagles players have jumped to the defense of coach Nick Sirianni after Giants safety Julian Love said Sirianni was on a “free ride” to the Super Bowl.

entries.title: 3 American tourists attacked, stabbed after dispute over filming in popular Puerto Rico neighborhood
entries.description: Three Americans were reportedly chased down and stabbed Monday after filming in La Perla, a San Juan, Puerto Rico, neighborhood made popular by a viral music video.

entries.title: Missouri FedEx driver dies in collision with Amtrak train
entries.description: A Missouri FedEx driver died in a collision with an Amtrak train early Tuesday morning. The crash occurred outside of Kansas City, and no train passengers were injured.

entries.title: Utah man Googled questions about gunshot noises before committing murder-suicide
entries.description: A Utah man Googled questions about gunshot noises before he committed a murder-suicide 5 days later. The man fatally shot his wife, her mother, their five kids, then himself.

entries.title: House GOP gets ahead of Biden State of the Union with debt ceiling calls, Chinese spy flights rebuke
entries.description: House GOP lawmakers went after President Biden on the debt ceiling, and his handling of the Chinese surveillance balloon and the border crisis ahead of the State of the Union address Tuesday.

entries.title: Wisconsin Gov. Evers likely to suggest sales tax increase
entries.description: Democratic Wisconsin Gov. Tony Evers said Tuesday he would request that the state Legislature allow sales tax hikes at the county and municipal level.

entries.title: 'My Three Sons' actress Tina Cole says co-star 'wasn't ready' to marry her despite 'falling in love'
entries.description: Don Grady, who got his start as a Mouseketeer on “The Mickey Mouse Club,” passed away in 2012 at age 68. Tina Cole, his co-star on "My Three Sons," wrote a book titled "My Three Lives."

entries.title: Missouri recreational marijuana now available at Verts Neighborhood Dispensaries
entries.description: Missouri recreational marijuana is now available at Verts Neighborhood Dispensaries. Those who are 21 and over are able to purchase top-shelf Missouri cannabis strains.

entries.title: Senate candidate Mandela Barnes, who lost, called 'almost-winner' in mocked Axios report: 'So, a loser?'
entries.description: Axios labeled failed Wisconsin Democratic candidate Mandela Barnes the "almost winner" of last November's election, spurring Twitter users to mock the outlet.

entries.title: Oklahoma death row inmate says his father is responsible for 1996 crimes
entries.description: An Oklahoma death row inmate says that his father is the one responsible for the 1996 crimes he was sentenced for. The inmate was convicted of raping and killing an OU dance student.

entries.title: Pennsylvania man charged with homicide for killing officer
entries.description: Johnathan Jermia Morris, 31, of McKeesport, Pennsylvania, is charged with criminal homicide, aggravated assault, and attempted murder for killing a police officer and injuring another.

entries.title: Alice Cooper recalls seeing Jeff Beck on stage with Johnny Depp, two weeks before 'surprise' death
entries.description: Rocker Alice Cooper spoke with Fox News Digital about the last time he saw Jeff Beck alive, and why he was so shocked to learn of his passing.

entries.title: House Dem claims spike in fentanyl seized at border is a 'success'
entries.description: Rep. Katie Porter hailed the significant rise in fentanyl seizures at the southern border in recent years as a "success," during a House Oversight Committee hearing.

entries.title: Webb Space Telescope 'unexpectedly' finds its smallest asteroid yet
entries.description: The James Webb Space Telescope may have accidentally discovered an asteroid that NASA says is likely the smallest observed to date by the $10 billion-dollar observatory.

entries.title: Mom accused of kidnapping missing Missouri kids found at Florida supermarket pleads not guilty
entries.description: Kristi Nicole Gilley being held in Alachua County Jail in Florida after her arrest on a parental kidnapping warrant out of Clay County, Missouri, according to court documents.

entries.title: AOC loses battle to slow GOP push to expand new oil, natural gas leases on federal land
entries.description: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez lost her fight on Tuesday to link new drilling on federal land to health studies that show the health impacts of energy extraction.

entries.title: The Drifters musician Charlie Thomas dead at 85
entries.description: Charlie Thomas died from liver cancer Jan. 31, a longtime friend of the musician confirmed to Fox News Digital. Thomas was a member of the Drifters and a Rock & Roll Hall of Famer.

entries.title: Japanese LGBTQ activists demand country to adopt equal rights laws after aide’s recent discriminatory remark
entries.description: LQBTQ activists are urging Japan to adopt equal rights laws, legalize same-sex marriage, and ban sexual discrimination before the country hosts a Group of Seven summit in May.

entries.title: Kayleigh McEnany calls out Karine Jean-Pierre over 'gap' in China spy flight timeline
entries.description: "Outnumbered" co-host Kayleigh McEnany raised new questions on the timeline of events, which suggests officials may have waited three days to brief President Biden on the situation.

entries.title: Japanese court denies medical aid for children of Hiroshima atomic bomb survivors
entries.description: A Japanese court rejected a damage suit filed by children of Hiroshima survivors who are seeking medical aid. The plaintiffs said the impact of radiation exposure could be hereditary.

entries.title: 24 people killed in 2nd day of fighting in Somaliland
entries.description: At least 24 people were killed and 53 others were injured in the second day of fighting in Somaliland. Groups are seeking the reunification of Somaliland and Somalia.

entries.title: Russia’s Wagner forces accused of using drugs to bolster stamina on the front lines
entries.description: Russia's infamous Wagner Group has been accused of supplying its troops with performance enhancing drugs to keep up stamina on the front lines.

entries.title: Mississippi House pushes blueberry and opal as state symbols
entries.description: The Mississippi House votes to recognize the blueberry as the state fruit and an opal as the state gemstone. The bill will now move to the Senate for further discussion.

entries.title: Kansas Topgolf employee chases kid on driving range in viral video
entries.description: A child in Wichita, Kansas, has been caught on video being chased by a Topgolf employee after running out on the driving range, drawing laughter from golfers there.

entries.title: Steady rains trigger mudslides that killed at least 36 in Peru
entries.description: The steady rain in Peru triggered mudslides that killed at least 36 in several small villages. Local officials have asked for heavy machinery to move debris blocking important roads.

entries.title: Man charged in fatal shooting of Southern California deputy
entries.description: A man was charged with first-degree murder Monday in the fatal shooting of a Southern California sheriff’s deputy. The man fired at the officer Jan. 13 from a pickup truck.

entries.title: Accused Boston fentanyl dealer charged for 'monstrous' broad daylight murder of 13-year-old boy: 'Evil intent'
entries.description: Csean Alexander Skerritt, recently arrested by FBI Boston for the distribution of fentanyl, was charged Monday for the January broad daylight murder of 13-year-old Tyler Lawrence.

entries.title: Lamborghini reveals the last V12-powered cars it will build before going hybrid
entries.description: The Lamborghini Invencible and Autentica are two unique cars built by the company's Centro Stile division and are the last with a non-hybrid V12.

entries.title: Make a list of the best diet changes to help cut heart disease during American Heart Month
entries.description: A balanced diet full of whole grains, fruits and vegetables — and with less fats — can help reduce the risk of cardiovascular disease for millions of Americans.

entries.title: Surfer Bethany Hamilton sounds off on transgender women competing with females
entries.description: The Fox News Lifestyle Newsletter brings you trending stories on family, travel, food, neighbors helping neighbors, pets, autos, military veterans, heroes, faith and American values.

entries.title: Syrian infant whose mother appears to have given birth while buried underneath ruble saved by rescue crew
entries.description: An infant whose mother appears to have given birth under the rubble from the earthquake that shook Syria has been rescued. The girl's mother was found dead.

entries.title: Body found floating in man-made AZ lake at Mesa park
entries.description: A fire department at Mesa, Arizona, recovered a body that was found floating in the Dobson Rank Lake. The identity of the victim has not yet been released.

entries.title: Flooding from glacial lakes threaten communities in Asia, South America
entries.description: As glaciers melt into lakes, flooding has become a growing risk to 15 million people around the world. Asia faces the biggest risk as the Himalayan mountains heat up.

entries.title: Zambian authorities rearrest 8 Croatians after court drops child trafficking charges against them
entries.description: The charges against the Croatians accused of child trafficking were dropped earlier in the week. The eight Croatians were arrested so they won't leave Zambia

entries.title: Prince Harry’s alleged ‘older woman’ slams royal’s sex story in explosive tell-all ‘Spare’: ‘Really cringey’
entries.description: Prince Harry, the Duke of Sussex, alleged in his memoir "Spare" that he lost his virginity in a field outside a pub to an older woman. Sasha Walpole alleged she's the mystery woman.

entries.title: Republicans punish Biden for missing budget deadline with bill restricting appointee pay, travel
entries.description: Republicans introduced legislation Tuesday that would delay federal funds to the president after a failure to meet the deadline to submit a budget to Congress.

entries.title: The state of the union is not strong and Biden should step aside in 2024, voters tell 'Fox & Friends'
entries.description: A panel of Republican, Democratic and moderate voters voiced concerns about the country and President Biden's fitness for office on "Fox & Friends" Tuesday.

entries.title: Catholic high school allegedly suspends student for opposing transgender ideology
entries.description: James Alexander, a 16-year-old Catholic high school student in Ontario, is appealing to a human rights tribunal after allegedly being suspended for claiming there are only two genders.

entries.title: Michigan rappers shot multiple times before bodies dumped in apartment, killings not random: police
entries.description: Authorities investigating the triple murder of three rappers in Michigan have released their cause of death and believe they have a motive.

entries.title: Members of Congress troll social media with hunting photos after Sen. Daines was put in 'Twitter jail'
entries.description: Multiple Republican members of Congress took to Twitter on Tuesday to defend Montana GOP Sen. Steve Daines after the social media giant locked and suspended his account.

entries.title: China wants its downed spy aircraft back, saying it 'does not belong to the US'
entries.description: Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson Mao Ning told reporters Tuesday that China has requested the return of the surveillance aircraft shot down over the United States.

entries.title: Texas state senator arrested for drunk driving
entries.description: Texas State Sen. Charles Schwertner has been arrested Tuesday on a driving while intoxicated charged after being stopped by the Austin Police Department.

entries.title: Top law enforcement group comes out swinging against anti-police Biden nominee
entries.description: The National Sheriffs' Association formally announced its opposition to Gigi Sohn, President Biden's nominee for an open Federal Communications Commission, over her views on police.

entries.title: Florida mass shooting suspect leads police on chase, killed after carjacking
entries.description: Police in Florida shot and killed a 21-year-old man suspected in a drive-by shooting that wounded 11 men after he led officers on a chase and attempted to carjack a vehicle.

entries.title: BBC Radio issues apology after trans gamer rails against J.K. Rowling for 'transphobia': 'We fell short here'
entries.description: "Harry Potter" author J.K. Rowling faced criticism from trans gamer Stacey Henley on BBC Radio, forcing the platform to apologize for the remarks.

entries.title: Fox News Politics: Eyes on Biden
entries.description: Get the latest updates from the 2024 campaign trail, exclusive interviews and more Fox News politics content

entries.title: Wisconsin Republican lawmakers order audit of state's Department of Safety and Professional Services
entries.description: Republicans ordered an audit of the Wisconsin Department of Safety and Professional Services. The department is known for lengthy delays and takes weeks to issue professional licenses.

entries.title: New York City residents torn over efforts to shelter migrants: ‘We’re not even helping our own people'
entries.description: New Yorkers share whether the city has prioritized migrants over the homeless as illegal immigrants protest outside the luxury hotel refusing to relocate.

entries.title: Moore v Harper: Supreme Court could throw out major North Carolina election theory case with 2024 implications
entries.description: North Carolina's Supreme Court agreed to rehear a major redistricting case, leaving Moore v. Harper's "independent state legislature theory" hanging in the balance at the federal level.

entries.title: Earthquakes in Turkey, Syria prompt UN to activate emergency satellite mapping
entries.description: The United Nations activated its emergency mapping satellite service following the devastating earthquakes that left more than 5,300 people dead in Turkey and Syria on Monday.

entries.title: Stefanik blasts Biden’s slow response to Chinese surveillance flight: He has ‘abysmally failed’
entries.description: House Republican Conference chairwoman Elise Stefanik of New York weighed in on President Biden's handling of the Chinese spy balloon that traveled over the continental U.S.

entries.title: Massachusetts mom Lindsay Clancy's 911 dispatch reveals frantic first responders
entries.description: Massachusetts mom Lindsay Clancy, who's accused of killing her children, is still recovering in the hospital, where she will be arraigned Tuesday afternoon.

entries.title: Al Sharpton blasts Meghan Markle backlash: It was 'somebody Black working in the C-suites' for the first time
entries.description: Rev. Al Sharpton defended Meghan Markle from media backlash, suggesting she was the victim of racism.

entries.title: Weaponization of government panel to hold first hearing on DOJ's alleged attack on American civil liberties
entries.description: The House Subcommittee on Weaponization is set to hold its first hearing Thursday on how the Justice Department have allegedly attacked American civil liberties.

entries.title: 'Trans Lives Matter' protesters occupy Oklahoma State Capitol: ‘This is our house!’
entries.description: Trans Lives Matter protesters chanted "this is our house," and "protect trans kids," inside the Oklahoma state Capitol Monday during Gov. Kevin Stitt’s State of the State address.

entries.title: Florida sees most unprovoked shark attacks on Earth in 2022
entries.description: Florida had most unprovoked shark attacks on Earth last year, with none resulting in fatalities. Most of the 57 unprovoked bites in 2022 occurred in the U.S. and Australia.

entries.title: Fire at Massachusetts hospital's electrical transformer forces evacuations
entries.description: A Massachusetts hospital was evacuated and the power was shut off after a fire broke out at the hospital's electrical transformer. Some critically ill patients were removed.

entries.title: Extreme cold passes through New England, plumbers still dealing with burst pipes, broken sprinklers in region
entries.description: Plumbers and firefighters in New England are still dealing with burst pipes and broken sprinklers in New England, even though the extreme temperatures have passed.

entries.title: Comer takes aim at Biden ‘propaganda’ on border crisis; WH tells GOP to ‘look in the mirror’
entries.description: The head of the House Oversight Committee slammed "propaganda" from the Biden administration as it sought to blame Republicans for the ongoing migrant crisis.

entries.title: Riley Gaines, former Kentucky women's swimming star, set to attend State of the Union address
entries.description: Riley Gaines, a former women's swimming star at Kentucky, will be Rep. Lisa McClain's guest of honor at the State of the Union address on Tuesday night.

entries.title: American 'wrongfully detained' on death row in China as officials call for release
entries.description: Texas Republicans are renewing calls for the release of Mark Swidan, a 38-year-old American on death row in China on drug charges the U.N. says is wrongfully detained.

entries.title: Pamela Anderson says Tim Allen 'has to deny' flashing allegations, acted like a 'giddy schoolboy' on set
entries.description: Pamela Anderson hits back at Tim Allen's claims he didn't flash her on the set of "Home Improvement." She said the actor "has to deny it" given the world today.

entries.title: Hollywood reporters erupt over Dave Chappelle's Grammy win for 'transphobic' Netflix special
entries.description: Comedian Dave Chappelle won a Grammy award for a 2021 comedy special that LGBTQ activists deemed "transphobic" and attempted to cancel him over.

entries.title: House China threat hearing: GOP rep warns of 'devastating' 30 years if US doesn't deter Beijing
entries.description: The House Armed Services Committee held its first hearing Tuesday to discuss threats posed to US national security by the Chinese Communist Party.

entries.title: Leah Remini 'emotional' as she sends only daughter Sofia to college for second time: ‘More of a mess now’
entries.description: "Saved by the Bell" alum Leah Remini shared an emotional post about sending her and Angelo Pagan's only daughter Sofia to college for the second time around.

entries.title: Streamers may lose their jobs if they play new 'transphobic' 'Harry Potter' game: 'Say goodbye to your career'
entries.description: "Hogwarts Legacy" is one of the most anticipated games this year. But thanks to a new website, the cancel culture vibe surrounding it may threaten careers.

entries.title: Federal judge suggests Constitution protects abortion rights, despite Dobbs decision
entries.description: D.C. District Judge Colleen Kollar-Kotelly, a Clinton appointee, on Monday suggested that the 13th Amendment to the U.S. Constitution protects the right to abortion.

entries.title: US infections rates related to kidney dialysis are higher among minorities, CDC reports
entries.description: The Center for Disease Control and Prevention reported that bloodstream infection rates related to kidney dialysis are higher among Blacks and Hispanics and in areas with more poverty.

entries.title: Mysterious meningitis outbreak in Mexico kills 35
entries.description: A mysterious outbreak of meningitis in Durango, Mexico, has infected 79 people and killed 35 others in the past few months. It is unclear where the infections began.

entries.title: Florida woman crashes ‘repurposed’ school bus into Louisiana school after police chase; blowtorch seized
entries.description: Natalie Jade Jarvis, of Florida, led deputies in St. Tammany Parish on a chase that ended with a crash onto the campus of a school in Covington, Louisiana, officials said.

entries.title: NC bill limiting gender identity, sexuality education in school to reach the Senate
entries.description: A North Carolina bill that would limit LGBTQ lessons in school will reach the Senate floor. If passed, the bill would prohibit sexuality and gender identity education in the classroom.

entries.title: Gabby Petito update: Newly released high-res photo shows injuries from Utah domestic call
entries.description: A newly unveiled picture shows Gabby Petito moments before Moab police pulled over Brian Laundrie in response to a domestic violence call in August 2021.

entries.title: Ashton Kutcher says 'awkward' photos with Reese Witherspoon were an attempt to avoid 'affair' rumors
entries.description: Ashton Kutcher admitted he didn't want people to think he was having an affair with co-star Reese Witherspoon at the "Your Place or Mine" premiere. Photos of the two went viral.

entries.title: Tom Brady's offensive coordinator a ‘serious candidate’ for Notre Dame OC job
entries.description: Former Tampa Bay Buccaneers offensive coordinator Byron Leftwich is a "serious candidate" for the OC job at Notre Dame. Tommy Rees recently left the Irish for Alabama.

entries.title: Biden plagued by negative approval ratings ahead of second State of the Union speech
entries.description: Ahead of his second State of the Union address, President Joe Biden continues to be plagued by an underwater approval rating despite a better than expected midterm election performance.

entries.title: Moscow, Idaho church deacon wins motion over COVID-protest arrest at outdoor hymn sing: 'I feel vindicated'
entries.description: Church deacon Gabriel Rench won his legal case against the City of Moscow, Idaho, after he was arrested in 2020 for alleged COVID-19 violations during an outdoor hymn sing.

entries.title: Pastor facing 10 years in prison for preaching at Canada trucker blockade protesting vaccine mandates
entries.description: Canadian pastor Artur Pawlowski told Fox News' Laura Ingraham he could see up to 10 years in jailtime for preaching a sermon at last year's Canadian trucker convoy.

entries.title: Super Bowl miracle: Massive TV stolen from California man returned just in time for the big game
entries.description: A TV stolen from a California man in Sonoma County was returned to him just in time for the Super Bowl after good Samaritans turned it over to authorities.

entries.title: Tom Brady's mom, Oprah Winfrey congratulate legendary quarterback on retirement
entries.description: Tom Brady received a bunch of great retirement wishes from colleagues and legends across all industries in the latest episode of his podcast.

entries.title: Scalise says GOP working on resolution to condemn Biden's handling of China's surveillance flight
entries.description: Republicans are working on putting forward a formal resolution to condemn the Biden administration's handling of the Chinese spy balloon.

entries.title: Biden expected to call for unity at State of the Union after repeated attacks against Republicans
entries.description: President Biden is expected to call for national unity during the State of the Union address after attacking Republicans and Trump supporters for months.

entries.title: Biden 'should not run again' advises NY Times columnist ahead of State of the Union: 'Too old'
entries.description: Michelle Goldberg, a New York Times opinion columnist, discouraged President Biden from running for re-election in 2024 ahead of his State of the Union address.

entries.title: Consumer Reports says these are the most and least satisfying vehicles
entries.description: The Chevrolet Corvette has been named the most satisfying vehicle to own in a Consumer Reports survey that asks owners if they'd buy their model again.

entries.title: GOP contrasts majority agenda with Biden's 'failed far-left policies' ahead of State of the Union
entries.description: House Republican leaders held a press conference ahead of President Biden's State of the Union address Tuesday evening, contrasting their agenda with the administration's.

entries.title: Former AL police detective sentenced for killing a woman she caught with her romantic partner
entries.description: Former Alabama police detective Alfreda Fluker was sentenced to life in prison for capital murder. Fluker killed a woman she caught being intimate with her romantic partner.

entries.title: Spanish archaeologists uncover 14th-century synagogue hidden within a converted church, hospital, bar
entries.description: Spanish archaeologist Miguel Ángel de Dios claims to have found a 14th century synagogue hidden within a converted church, hospital, and bar.

entries.title: Former London police officer sentenced to life in prison after he admitted to being a serial rapist
entries.description: David Carrick, a former police officer in London, admitted to being a serial rapist. He was sentenced to life in prison with a minimum term of 30 years.

entries.title: NYC police union boss faces leadership challenge amid city's crime, staffing woes: 'inject new blood'
entries.description: Corey Grable, who joined the NYPD 27 years ago, launched a campaign against PBA President Pat Lynch, who has been in the job since 1999, promising to secure a police contract.

entries.title: Ecuadorian city mayor candidate murdered by assassins hours before winning election: report
entries.description: A candidate for mayor in Ecuador has won the election after he was murdered ahead of polls opening over the weekend.

entries.title: Ohio train derailment: Residents still barred from homes after toxic chemicals released from cars
entries.description: Residents of East Palestine, Ohio, wait to go home after crew members released and burned hazardous chemicals from five rail cars involved in Friday's train derailment.

entries.title: Denmark's defensive minister takes a leave of absence after a medical checkup in Copenhagen
entries.description: Jakob Ellemann-Jensen, Denmark's 49-year-old defensive minister, is taking a leave of absence. He claimed to feel unwell after a medical checkup at Copenhagen hospital last week.

entries.title: WV regulators deny request that would have increased electric bills by $18 on average
entries.description: West Virginia regulators have denied a request that would have increased the electric utility rate by 12%. Appalachian Power said the increase is necessary due to rising fuel costs.

entries.title: ‘No evidence’ China surveillance flights were used to spread COVID, says House Intel committee member
entries.description: The top Democrat on the House Select Committee on Intelligence said he has seen no evidence that the China spy balloon was used to spread the COVID pandemic.

entries.title: In AL, body of missing kayaker found submerged in Bayview Lake
entries.description: The body of a man who went missing on Jan. 28 was recovered Sunday from Bayview Lake, Alabama. The man went missing after he told his family he was going to go kayak fishing.

entries.title: COVID-19's lasting impact: 'Less attractive' people wear masks more often than others, study finds
entries.description: A new study published in Frontiers in Psychology says that people who think they are less attractive than others are likely to keep wearing masks when they're motivated to make good impressions.

entries.title: Kim Jong Un orders ramped up military readiness after going missing for a month
entries.description: North Korean dictator Kim Jong Un ordered increased military readiness and more exercises from his armed forces ahead of a massive military parade in the country.

entries.title: GOP reps spar with Oversight Dems at border hearing over 'white nationalist' claim
entries.description: Republicans sparred with Democrats on the House Oversight Committee about a tweet that accused the GOP of pushing "white nationalist conspiracy theories" over the border.

entries.title: 6-year-old Virginia boy who shot teacher allegedly choked another: report
entries.description: A 6-year-old Virginia boy who shot and wounded his first-grade teacher in January reportedly attempted to choke another teacher before he was pulled off her.

entries.title: The state of President Biden is weak, thanks to his fentanyl crisis
entries.description: Biden's chaos at the border has enabled a deluge of deadly drugs to sweep into and across America.

entries.title: How to reverse search an image on your phone
entries.description: Using a reverse image search in Safari on your iPhone, or the Chrome browser on Android, can help you determine whether the person chatting with you is real.

entries.title: Oklahoma Gov. Stitt gets standing ovation calling for bill that 'bans all gender transition surgeries'
entries.description: Oklahoma GOP Gov. Kevin Stitt is calling on state lawmakers to deliver a bill to his desk that “bans all gender transition surgeries” for minors.

entries.title: Russia working with Burma's military-led government to develop nuclear power to fill energy shortages
entries.description: Russia is working with Burma's government to develop nuclear power to fill energy shortages in the country. The Nuclear Technology Information Center recently opened in Burma.

entries.title: China outpaces US in missile launchers, Pentagon tells Congress
entries.description: The U.S. military notified Congress in January it is outpaced by China in land-based intercontinental-range missile launchers, a January letter to Congress revealed.

entries.title: Xi will drive a truck through Biden's weakness, Jill not Joe for president and more Fox News Opinion
entries.description: Read the latest Fox News Opinion columns and watch videos from Tucker Carlson, Sean Hannity, Laura Ingraham and more.

entries.title: Don Lemon trashes New York Post as 'uncredible' source on Hunter Biden: 'We don't have a shared reality'
entries.description: CNN anchor Don Lemon trashed Rep. James Comer's, R-Ky., for claiming The New York Post was a "credible" source on the Hunter Biden laptop story.

entries.title: Sen. Tim Scott vows he will not applaud at State of the Union for Biden's handling of China spy flight
entries.description: Sen. Tim Scott argues President Biden's hesitation to take out the Chinese surveillance balloon was a 'dereliction of duty' and demonstrated weakness to America's enemies.

entries.title: Russian court upholds verdict to revoke license of top independent newspaper that criticized the Kremlin
entries.description: An independent newspaper in Russia had its license revoked. A Russian court upheld the verdict to revoke the newspaper's license. The paper has been critical of the Kremlin for years,

entries.title: Intruder breaks into Air Force One facility, guard opens fire
entries.description: An intruder broke into Joint Base Andrews and snuck into the area where the president's Air Force One planes are kept before being fired upon by a base resident Monday.

entries.title: NYC man opens fire during attempted jewelry store robbery, leaves empty-handed, video shows
entries.description: New York City police are looking for a suspect who entered a jewelry store in Brooklyn and opened fire, wounded a 24-year-old worker, before running away empty-handed.

entries.title: Serial killer featured in Netflix series 'The Serpent' says he never killed anyone
entries.description: Charles Sobhraj allegedly killed at least 20 tourists in South Asia, preying on them when they would stay at his hostel so he could steal their passports.

entries.title: Jalen Hurts does not have ‘anything to prove’ in order to be long-term answer at QB, Eagles owner says
entries.description: Philadelphia Eagles owner Jeffrey Lurie told ESPN that quarterback Jalen Hurts does not "anything to prove" in order to be the long-term answer at quarterback.

entries.title: Prince Harry's sex confession questioned, Gisele Bündchen feels empowered amid Tom Brady retirement
entries.description: The Fox News Entertainment newsletter brings you the latest Hollywood headlines, celebrity interviews and stories from Los Angeles and beyond.

entries.title: Twitter locks Sen. Steve Daines' account for 'graphic violence' over hunting photo
entries.description: Twitter locked Montana Republican Sen. Steve Daines' account Monday after he uploaded a profile picture showcasing his latest hunt with his wife.

entries.title: Baltimore power grid attack suspect had 'wish list' of guns, sought to 'completely destroy this whole city'
entries.description: Sarah Beth Clendaniel, charged with plotting to attack five substations around Baltimore, allegedly told an FBI informant she sought to "completely destroy this whole city."

entries.title: Family member of 6-year-old boy who died in Detroit house fire arrested
entries.description: Police in Detroit, Michigan say they have arrested a family member accused of child abandonment after a 6-year-old boy died in a house fire over the weekend.

entries.title: Tennessee sex-romp cop scandal: Police chief fired after city discovers he knew of escapades among officers
entries.description: The chief the La Vergne Police Department in Tennessee has been fired after an investigation found he knew about sexual misconduct among former officer Maegan Hall and male colleagues.

entries.title: These are the top searched foods in anticipation of Super Bowl LVII, according to Google
entries.description: Super Bowl LVII is highly anticipated, but for more than just the football game. Dishes including Buffalo chicken dip, queso, bread and more are the top searched recipes for game day.

entries.title: Wisconsin police officer fatally shot in exchange of gunfire with robber, suspect also killed
entries.description: A shootout between a robber and a Milwaukee police officer resulted in the death of the officer and the suspect. The suspect fled from officers before shots were fired.

entries.title: Major medical group wipes study advocating doctors give less anesthesia to reduce carbon footprint
entries.description: A top medical group deleted mention of research suggesting that reducing anesthetic gas in surgery could be an effective tool to combat climate change.

entries.title: Biden's latest border gambit opens America's doors to evil child smugglers
entries.description: The Biden administration has doubled down on the policies that sparked the southern border crisis.

entries.title: Border hawks say failure to pass border security bill would betray GOP 'Commitment to America'
entries.description: Conservative groups who oppose illegal immigration are demanding that the Republican House majority take immediate action to secure the border.

entries.title: Ted Cruz says Biden will not be nominee in 2024, says knives out 'from every direction' for Kamala Harris
entries.description: Sen. Ted Cruz joined "Jesse Watters Primetime" to discuss Biden and Kamala facing criticism from Democrats and why the China spy flight should have been shot down sooner.

entries.title: Sen. Daines responds after Twitter suspends his account for hunting photo: 'My wife is a great shot'
entries.description: Sen. Steve Daines, R-Mont., was suspended from Twitter on Monday over claims that his profile photo, featuring him and his wife hunting, reportedly violated Twitter guidelines.

entries.title: Ukraine: Russia has suffered record 1,030 troop deaths in a 24-hour span
entries.description: Ukraine says more than 1,000 Russian troops have been killed on the battlefield in a 24-hour span, setting a new record for the war, a report says.

entries.title: Nurse Lucy Letby wrote sympathy card to parents of baby girl she’s accused of murdering
entries.description: The trial of Lucy Letby continues in the United Kingdom. Letby is on trial in the U.K. and is accused of killing seven babies and attempting to kill another 10. She has denied all charges against her.

entries.title: South Korean court orders government to pay Vietnamese woman who survived gunshot during the Vietnam War
entries.description: A Vietnamese woman was shot when South Korean marines rampaged through her village during the war in 1968. A court in South Korea ordered the government to pay the woman $24,000.

entries.title: Tom Brady dismisses Bill Belichick Patriots credit debate: 'Such a stupid conversation'
entries.description: Tom Brady attempted to put the debate over who deserves more credit for the Patriots' success – him or Bill Belichick – to rest on Monday night.

entries.title: McCarthy says he won't repeat Pelosi 'theatrics' and rip up Biden’s SOTU speech
entries.description: House Speaker Kevin McCarthy said Tuesday he won't rip up President Biden's State of the Union address the way Nancy Pelosi ripped up President Trump's in 2020.

entries.title: New York off-duty cop shooting suspect captured using critically wounded officer's handcuffs
entries.description: A 38-year-old Brooklyn man named Randy Jones has been accused of critically wounding an off-duty NYPD officer in a robbery attempt, sources tell Fox News.

entries.title: Jennifer Lopez and husband Ben Affleck had 'the best time' at the Grammys despite his 'miserable' viral memes
entries.description: Jennifer Lopez praised husband Ben Affleck on social media after he went viral online during the Grammy Awards for his seemingly bored disposition.

entries.title: CA woman who pleaded guilty to statutory rape of teen boys to serve 8 years in prison
entries.description: A 35-year-old California woman pleaded guilty to statutory rape of teenage boys. The woman will serve eight years in prison for victimizing three minors.

entries.title: KY schedules listening tour to gather input for internet broadband plan
entries.description: Kentucky Gov. Andy Beshear said state officials have scheduled a six-week listening tour that will help officials identify which areas needs better internet access.

entries.title: President Biden hosts Paul Pelosi at State of the Union
entries.description: President Biden will host Paul Pelosi, husband of Rep. Nancy Pelosi, as a guest for the State of the Union after he was assaulted by a home intruder last year.

entries.title: French demonstrators take to the streets for nationwide protest against the government's pension reform plans
entries.description: Demonstrators took to the street in France to protest the government's pension reform plans. The pension bill would raise the retirement age from 62 to 64.

entries.title: 3 migrants dead, 16 rescued off Greek island of Lesbos after dinghy crashes into rocks
entries.description: A dinghy carrying migrants crashed into the rocks off the Greek island of Lesbos. Three of the migrants died and 16 others were rescued by the Greek Coast Guard.

entries.title: Biden to make 'reference' to Chinese spy flights in State of the Union address: official
entries.description: President Biden will reference the Chinese surveillance aircraft that dominated news cycles and political discussion last week before finally being shot down.

entries.title: Ahead of Biden's address to Congress, fierce debate on Twitter: 'Hard to say the State of the Union is strong'
entries.description: Twitter users engaged in heated debate over the state of the nation and the administration's record in advance of President Joe Biden's State of the Union address.

entries.title: Alleged human smuggler in Arizona arrested after rollover crash, illegal immigrants ejected: sheriff
entries.description: Timothy Bryoles, 32, was allegedly attempting to smuggle illegal immigrants when he fled from a traffic stop on I-10 and led deputies in Pinal County on a brief chase.

entries.title: How to tell if your phone has been hacked
entries.description: Your phone may be compromised without you even knowing it. Kurt "CyberGuy" Knutsson shows you how to find out if your phone has been and what to do about it.

entries.title: Funeral for Pakistan's former President Pervez Musharraf held in Karachi, attended by over 2,500 mourners
entries.description: The funeral for Pervez Musharraf, the former president of Pakistan, was held on Tuesday in Karachi. The funeral was attended by over 2,500 mourners.

entries.title: Patrick Mahomes' father 'proud' he'll get to see his son make NFL history at Super Bowl LVII
entries.description: Patrick Mahomes Sr., father of the Chiefs' star QB, spoke to Fox News Digital about the importance of his son and Eagles' QB Jalen Hurts making NFL history at Super Bowl LVII.

entries.title: Buttigieg, FAA pressed for details on airline safety after Chinese spy mission delays flights
entries.description: Rep. Kean wrote a letter to Sec. Buttigieg and the FAA probing the issuance of a ground stop on Feb. 4 for three airports while the Chinese surveillance balloon moved across the nation.

entries.title: CA deputies kill schizophrenic man armed with spike bat
entries.description: California deputies killed a schizophrenic man Monday. They tried to deescalate the situation but opened fire when the man charged at the deputies with a spike-tipped bat.

entries.title: Matthew McConaughey, Kate Hudson agree they 'kiss nicely,' share secrets of 'How to Lose A Guy in 10 Days'
entries.description: Matthew McConaughey and Kate Hudson spoke with one another via Instagram Live, discussing their film "How to Lose a Guy in 10 Days," as well as kissing one another on-camera.

entries.title: Patriots' Bill Belichick lauds Tom Brady, reminisces about coaching him: 'Just the greatest player'
entries.description: New England Patriots coach Bill Belichick had nothing but good things to say when it came to Tom Brady and the career the quarterback put together.

entries.title: US releases first images of China spy flight recovery efforts as divers recover debris
entries.description: The US Military released its first public photos of the effort to recover debris from the shot-down Chinese spy balloon Monday, showing ships and helicopters in the area.

entries.title: After split from Arnold Schwarzenegger, Maria Shriver confesses she visited a convent to seek advice
entries.description: 67-year-old journalist Maria Shriver got candida bout her healing journey after her split with former Califonia governor Schwarzenegger and confessed she visited a convent.

entries.title: Teen girl shot while visiting family inside southwest Philadelphia home: police
entries.description: Philadelphia police are looking for two men after witnesses say they opened fire on a home with six children and some adults early Tuesday morning on the southwest side of the city.

entries.title: Thai rescue crew retrieves 18-month-old girl from 49-foot-deep well shaft
entries.description: A young Thai child fell into a hole at a farm late at night on Tuesday. Rescue workers successfully recovered the girl during an overnight operation.

entries.title: Neo-Nazi leader charged in Maryland power grid attack plot arrested years ago after roommates' double murder
entries.description: Brandon Clint Russell, charged with plotting to destroy energy facilities in Maryland, was previously arrested after his Florida roommate murdered two others in a dispute on Islam.

entries.title: AK polar bear that killed a young mother, 1-year-old baby was in poor physical condition
entries.description: A polar bear mauled a mother and her 1-year-old son to death as they were leaving a school in Alaska. Tests indicate that the bear was in poor health but it is unclear as to why.

entries.title: Israeli troops kill Palestinian teen in army raid in occupied West Bank
entries.description: A 17-year-old Palestinian boy was killed by Israeli troops during a raid in the occupied West Bank. The teen died of a gunshot wound to the head.

entries.title: Wet weather brings flooding risk to South, Mississippi Valley
entries.description: While a storm brings the risk of flooding across the South and Mississippi Valley through Wednesday, stronger storms could bring the potential for isolated tornadoes in Texas.

entries.title: 1 missing, 2 rescued after WA crab boat sinks near Willapa Bay
entries.description: A crab boat sank and broke apart near Willapa Bay, Washington. Rescuers were able to save two people, but a third person is still reported missing.

entries.title: Christian Atsu, Ghana soccer star, found alive in rubble after powerful earthquake leaves thousands dead
entries.description: Christian Atsu, a Ghanian soccer star who plays in Turkey, was rescued from the rubble left by a powerful earthquake that struck the country.

entries.title: Lawmakers head to Texas to expose dangers of Biden’s ‘open borders’ agenda, fentanyl crisis
entries.description: Republicans will host members of Rep. Cathy McMorris Rodgers' committee at two locations in Texas as she works to focus attention on the administration's "open border agenda."

entries.title: Oregon lawmakers consider cutting millions from addiction services after decriminalizing drugs
entries.description: Two years into Oregon's first-in-the-nation drug decriminalization law, policy makers are debating reinvesting addiction funds into cities and public safety.

entries.title: Biden admin under fire for pursuing diversity over merit: They're finding people 'who aren't highly-skilled'
entries.description: Project 21 co-chairman Horace Cooper reacts to President Biden's judicial nominees and reports that out of 97 confirmed federal judges, only five are white on 'Tucker Carlson Tonight.'

entries.title: Pittsburgh-area voters to fill out vacancies in PA House race, may resolve stalemate over majority control
entries.description: Pittsburgh-area voters may be able to end the stalemate over majority control in the state House of Representatives. The voters can fill out three vacancies on Tuesday.

entries.title: Military helicopter crash in AK injures 2 soldiers
entries.description: A military helicopter that crashed in Alaska injured two soldiers Sunday. The soldiers were taken to local hospitals for treatment and were later released.

entries.title: America's most beautiful custom car winners revealed
entries.description: The 2023 Grand National Roadster Show awards for most beautiful roadster and custom car have been given to a 1932 Ford and 1960 Buick Invicta.

entries.title: Chiefs' JuJu Smith-Schuster makes bold statement about Philly cheesesteaks
entries.description: Kansas City Chiefs wide receiver JuJu Smith-Schuster gave a bold opinion about Philly cheesesteaks at Super Bowl Opening Night on Monday.

entries.title: Attorney Harry Whittington, who was shot by Dick Cheney in 2006 hunting mishap, dies
entries.description: Texas attorney Harry Whittington, remembered by many as the man accidentally shot by then-Vice President Dick Cheney, died Saturday according to Karl Rove, a long time friend.

entries.title: Mayor blasts 'leading white Democrats' reportedly trying to oust Harris after NYT casts doubts on 2024 hopes
entries.description: Mayor Eric Johnson came to Vice President Kamala Harris' defense after a New York Times article suggested the Democratic Party is seeking to separate themselves from her as 2024 nears.

entries.title: Maryland transit bus crashes into tractor trailer, 1 taken to hospital
entries.description: A messy scene needed to be cleaned up late Monday night in Maryland after a Montgomery County transit bus collided with a tractor-trailer on an interstate.

entries.title: Tom Brady opens himself up to razzing from former NFL colleagues over underwear selfie
entries.description: Tom Brady faced some trash talk from his former NFL colleagues on Monday after he posted a selfie in his underwear to promote the Brady Brand.

entries.title: Wisconsin woman sentenced to 15 years in prison for her role in the fatal shooting of her 18-year-old son
entries.description: The mother of an 18-year-old man who was killed has been sentenced to 15 years in prison for her role in his death. The teen was confronted with reptile theft worth nearly $30,000.

entries.title: AMC Theaters getting pummeled for their 3-tier seat pricing: 'Corporate greed'
entries.description: AMC Theatres announced its three-tier seat pricing on Monday, sparking outrage from some who claim the move will hurt low-income moviegoers.

entries.title: Roads blocked in Wisconsin due to dispute involving homeowners, American Indian tribe
entries.description: A dispute involving homeowners and an American Indian tribe has led to roads being blocked in northern Wisconsin. The tribe claims the roads were illegally built on its reservation.

entries.title: Church of England synod member claims bishop called police over tweets against gay pride, 'queer theory'
entries.description: Sam Margrave, a lay member of the Church of England's general synod, said his bishop called the police on him after he publicly expressed opinions against pride and queer theory.

entries.title: Over 100 groups back Manchin, GOP plan to block Biden’s ‘woke’ ESG investing rule
entries.description: More than 100 conservative groups are urging Congress to roll back Biden's "politically inappropriate" and "financially irresponsible" ESG investment rule.

entries.title: Kamala Harris dodged interviews for a year after 'disastrous' border comments to NBC News' Lester Holt: Report
entries.description: Vice President Kamala Harris dodged the media for roughly a full a year after a "disastrous" 2021 interview with NBC about securing the border, according to The New York Times.

entries.title: CMA Awards 2022: Country music honored in Nashville
entries.description: Morgan Wallen, Carrie Underwood and Katy Perry will perform at the 56th annual Country Music Association awards at the Bridgestone Arena in Tennessee. Miranda Lambert will lead a tribute to late singer Loretta Lynn, and Alan Jackson to be honored with the Willie Nelson lifetime achievement award at the ceremony hosted by Luke Bryan and Peyton Manning.

entries.title: Rescuers race to find earthquake survivors, single ticket wins Powerball jackpot and more top headlines
entries.description: DEVASTATING DISASTER - Earthquake deaths surpass 5,000 in Turkey, Syria as rescuers race against the clock to find survivors

entries.title: Jet crashes in Australia, 2 pilots walk away with minor injuries
entries.description: A Boeing 737 jet crashed in Australia. The two pilots survived the crash, with minor injuries. The jet was engulfed in flames and smoke upon impact.

entries.title: NFL players lean into 'script' jokes at Pro Bowl Games: 'I was a little shook'
entries.description: NFL players ran with the "script" joke at the Pro Bowl Games over the weekend. Several players leaned in when they were asked about it.

entries.title: Harry Styles sparks backlash with Grammys acceptance speech: 'The most White privilege-iest thing'
entries.description: Harry Styles took home the award for 'Album of the Year' at the Grammy Awards, but his acceptance speech has prompted criticism from viewers accusing him of white privilege.

entries.title: The vote for House speaker
entries.description: Live coverage as the House votes for a new speaker.

entries.title: Newest death-defying stunt comes to TikTok: ‘Death diving’
entries.description: "Death diving," an extreme sport that originated in Norway, is picking up momentum on TikTok, where videos of the dives are gaining millions of views.

entries.title: WWE star Cody Rhodes suggests current storylines 'even better' than The Rock returning at WrestleMania
entries.description: Cody Rhodes suggested the storylines the WWE has going right now are better than what The Rock could be thrown into for WrestleMania 39.

entries.title: Bonnie Raitt’s shocking Grammy win caps legendary career
entries.description: Bonnie Raitt won song of the year at the 2023 Grammys, beating out artists like Taylor Swift, Adele and Beyonce. The win was a happy surprise for the musician, who has had a legendary 50-year career.

entries.title: Newt Gingrich: Biden's State of the Union will be a 'fantasy address'
entries.description: Former Speaker of the House Newt Gingrich reveals what he believes President Biden will discuss in the State of the Union address on "America Reports."

entries.title: Think threat of China's spy flights are bad? It's much worse than you think
entries.description: That China thought it could fly a surveillance balloon into American air space is not good for America now, nor in the future.

entries.title: California GOP assembly leader says new law would 'encourage and enable human trafficking'
entries.description: California Democrats repealed a law that had banned loitering with the intent to engage in prostitution, a move some state Republicans say encourages human trafficking.

entries.title: WH press secretary gets scorched for fumbled explanation on China spy flights: 'What a load of crap'
entries.description: White House spokeswoman Karine Jean-Pierre struggled to answer a question about Chinese spy balloons in recent years, and commentators on the internet roasted her for it.

entries.title: Biden repeatedly fell short of promises he made in 2022 State of the Union address
entries.description: President Biden is falling behind on several major promises he made in his State of the Union address last year, including taming inflation and securing the border.

entries.title: America 'unrecognizable' and on the brink of collapse, experts warn: 'Turning on our own legacy'
entries.description: Fox Nation's 'American Requiem' dissects America's torn cultural fabric that faces a steady decline in light of inflation, division and foreign affairs.

entries.title: Rescuers search for survivors in Turkey, Syria after earthquake leaves more than 5,000 dead
entries.description: Rescuers in Turkey and Syria searched for more survivors after a 7.8 magnitude earthquake killed more than 5,000 people and toppled thousands of buildings.

entries.title: Jill Biden for president? It's more real than you think
entries.description: President Joe Biden is expected to announce soon after the State of the Union address that he will run for a second term. Increasingly his wife Jill Biden is taking on a bigger role.

entries.title: ABC, CBS, NBC continue to skip unflattering Hunter Biden news as hearing looms, study reveals
entries.description: Media Research Center founder and president Brent Bozell believes ABC, CBS and NBC are "whitewashing" negative information about President Biden's son, Hunter Biden.

entries.title: Ballooning through fear and anger, blaming Biden or Trump
entries.description: There is an abundance of anger, fear, and frustration amongst Americans as voters are not pleased with its leading presidential candidates.

entries.title: Costa Rica says China apologized for intel operation over its territory
entries.description: Costa Rica's government said Monday that China apologized for a spy balloon flying over its territory. China claims the balloon was primarily used for weather studies.

entries.title: State of the Union has Americans demanding answers from President Biden on top concerns
entries.description: Americans across the country told Fox News what they want to hear from the commander-in-chief when he delivers the State of the Union to Congress on Tuesday night.

entries.title: Michigan K-9 whose viral mugshot captivated Americans made big busts in his career: 'Best partner I ever had'
entries.description: Detective Ice, a Michigan police K-9 dog, has take the internet by storm after the release of his mugshot. Here's a deeper dive into this favorite furry defender.

entries.title: Biden's State of the Union must make amends for woke response to China spy threat
entries.description: President Biden delivers his State of the Union address Tuesday. He has a big job ahead. Biden and his national security team appeared incompetent in handling the Chinese spy balloon.

entries.title: State of the Union: Biden to discuss strategy to 'reassert America's leadership' on world stage
entries.description: President Biden will explain his strategy to “reassert America’s leadership around the world” during his second State of the Union address Tuesday, a White House official told Fox News.

entries.title: Georgia sheriff’s deputy recruit ends up in jail where he once worked after allegedly beating inmate
entries.description: A disturbance inside a Georgia jail ended with a sheriff's deputy recruit behind bars. The Cobb County Sheriff said the recruit beat an inmate he was attempting to relocate.

entries.title: GREG GUTFELD: We should point fingers at China and not at each other
entries.description: Greg Gutfeld gives his take on China's surveillance balloon flying over America and how the US responded on 'Gutfeld!'

entries.title: On this day in history, Feb. 7, 1964, Beatles arrive in US for first time, inspire nationwide mania
entries.description: The Beatles landed in the United States for the first time on this day in history, Feb. 7, 1964. America's love affair with the Fab Four from Britain has never ended.

entries.title: Chiefs' Andy Reid reunites with his former Eagles players, talks Super Bowl LVII preparation
entries.description: For 14 seasons, Andy Reid was the head coach of the Philadelphia Eagles. 10 years later, he's meeting them in Super Bowl LVII as the head coach of the Kansas City Chiefs.

entries.title: LAURA INGRAHAM: Biden's balloon fiasco was a national embarrassment
entries.description: Fox News host Laura Ingraham gives her take on the downing of the Chinese spy balloon and what it means for U.S.-China relations on 'The Ingraham Angle.'

entries.title: Patrick Mahomes promises wacky Super Bowl celebration with Cooper Manning if Chiefs win
entries.description: If the Kansas City Chiefs win Super Bowl LVII, quarterback Patrick Mahomes already knows what he'll be doing to celebrate and it involves Cooper Manning.

entries.title: SEAN HANNITY: Biden was trying to sweep the spy balloon under the rug
entries.description: Fox News host Sean Hannity explains what message President Biden sent to the Chinese Communist Party by waiting several days to shoot the spy balloon down on 'Hannity.'

entries.title: Jason and Travis Kelce's mother surprises sons with homemade gift during Super Bowl Opening Night
entries.description: Donna Kelce has become a bit of a celebrity since her sons, Eagles' Jason Kelce and Chiefs' Travis Kelce, made it to Super Bowl LVII. She surprised them on Opening Night.

entries.title: Eagles' Nick Siranni gives one-word answer to reporter's obvious question during Super Bowl Media Day
entries.description: Philadelphia Eagles head coach Nick Sirianni wasn't expecting such an obvious question as Super Bowl media kicked off Monday, but he gave a one-word answer to keep things going.

entries.title: Woke Grammys show 'culture wars are over and the left won' Joy Reid claims as she revels in 'total defeat'
entries.description: MSNBC host Joy Reid praised the Grammy Awards on Monday as a representation of diversity, equity and imagined "heads exploding in red states" in her monologue.

entries.title: Paramount responds to claims 'Yellowstone' ending with Kevin Costner, Matthew McConaughey to star in new show
entries.description: Kevin Costner portrays John Dutton on "Yellowstone." Oscar-winning actor Matthew McConaughey is reportedly in talks to join Taylor Sheridan franchise.

entries.title: Tony Romo responds to broadcast criticism: 'That's just noise'
entries.description: Once the up-and-coming color commentator in the NFL, Tony Romo has been criticized for his broadcasting on CBS with partner Jim Nantz. He responded to it recently.

entries.title: TUCKER CARLSON: The people who owe you the truth on China spy balloon are lying to you
entries.description: Fox News host Tucker Carlson voices his concerns over the Chinese spy balloon and calls out the Biden admin's response on "Tucker Carlson Tonight."

entries.title: Don Lemon in disbelief over 'disconnect' between Dem Party and leaders on Biden: 'The people love him'
entries.description: The morning CNN hosts discussed President Biden's support among Democratic Party leaders, with Lemon claiming he's loved by "the people."

entries.title: Texas border wall construction underway, Gov. Abbott says
entries.description: Texas Gov. Greg Abbott posted a video of a wall being constructed along the state's border with Mexico on Sunday, boasting that Texas was building its own wall.

entries.title: Florida House speaker investigates books in Hillsborough after content was challenged by parents
entries.description: Florida House Speaker Paul Renner announced he has requested records from school district officials regarding so-called "age-inappropriate" reading materials available to students.

entries.title: JESSE WATTERS: What we've done to protect against China is not working
entries.description: Fox News host Jesse Watters slams the Biden administration's response to a Chinese spy balloon on 'Jesse Watters Primetime.'

entries.title: Ohio skyline lit up by fireball, black plumes of smoke as toxic chemicals are released from derailed train
entries.description: Officials in Ohio started the controlled release of toxic chemicals from derailed train cars on Monday afternoon, sending black smoke and flames into the air.

entries.title: Michigan man who set Planned Parenthood clinic on fire gets 5 years
entries.description: Joshua Brereton, 25, has been sentenced to five years in prison for arson after a July 2022 incident in which he set fire to a Kalamazoo, Michigan, Planned Parenthood clinic.

entries.title: Broncos' Sean Payton bans personal coaches from locker room, including star QBs: 'That's foreign to me'
entries.description: Sean Payton's introduction as the Denver Broncos' new head coach has already brought change, as he said no personal coaches will be allowed on the premises, including Russell Wilson's.

entries.title: New Jersey AG announces charges for officer who shot fleeing suspect in back
entries.description: Democratic New Jersey Attorney General Matt Platkin has announced assault and misconduct charges against Paterson police officer Jerry Moravek, who shot a fleeing suspect in the back.

entries.title: Minnesota AG Ellison's office may soon receive millions in funding from Legislature
entries.description: Millions of dollars in state funding may soon be accessible to the office of state Attorney General Keith Ellison and an expanded public defender system.

entries.title: Arkansas lawmakers pass modified bill to restrict 'adult' and drag performances
entries.description: Arkansas legislators modified and approved a proposed bill that would restrict adult-oriented performances, specifically drag shows sexual in nature.

entries.title: Top Maine elections official testifies against mandatory voter ID
entries.description: Maine Secretary of State Shenna Bellows, the state's top elections official, testified against a bill requiring photo ID to vote, calling it unnecessary and potentially discriminatory.

entries.title: Colorado homeowners' Ring camera captures 2 mountain lions strolling across yard together
entries.description: Homeowners in Boulder Canyon, Colorado, are left "pleasantly surprised" after capturing footage of two mountain lions wandering together – as recorded on a Ring camera.

entries.title: Minnesota man convicted of North Dakota triple homicide gets life without parole
entries.description: Anthony Reese Jr. of Moorhead, Minnesota, was sentenced to life in prison without parole for the murders of two colleagues, one of whom was pregnant.
